file_name: PlayboyEnterprisesInc_20090220_10-QA_EX-10.2_4091580_EX-10.2_Content License Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Sales-Purchase Agreement1.pdf

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and, unless earlier terminated as provided under this Agreement, shall terminate five (5) years following the date of launch of the first Website, but in no event later than February 28, 2013 (the “Initial Term”). This Agreement shall automatically renew for an additional period of three (3) years (such renewal and each subsequent renewal shall be defined as a “Renewal Term”) provided that EFS achieves Net Merchandise Sales of at least ***** during the fourth year following launch of the first Website. In such event, the annual Minimum Royalty during the Renewal Term, if any, shall be equal to the greater of: (a) ***** of the actual Royalty paid to Client in Year 5; and (b) *****. The Initial Term and any and all Renewal Terms shall be collectively referred to as the “Term.”
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and, unless earlier terminated as provided under this Agreement, shall terminate five (5) years following the date of launch of the first Website, but in no event later than February 28, 2013 (the “Initial Term”). This Agreement may renew for an additional period of three (3) years (such renewal and each subsequent renewal shall be defined as a “Renewal Term”) if both parties agree in writing to the renewal, irrespective of EFS achieving Net Merchandise Sales of at least ***** during the fourth year following launch of the first Website. The annual Minimum Royalty during the Renewal Term, if any, will be negotiated separately for each renewal period. The Initial Term and any and all Renewal Terms shall be collectively referred to as the “Term.”
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies an automatic renewal based on achieving a sales target, while the modified version replaces this with renewal subject to mutual written agreement. This introduces uncertainty about whether the contract auto-renews or requires active agreement.

perturbation.original_text: EFS shall use User Data solely for purposes of the operation and promotion of the Playboy Commerce Business, and except as specifically approved in advance in writing by Client, shall not use such User Data to market any other EFS or third-party products or services to users or otherwise use, transfer or sell any User Data collected hereunder. Notwithstanding the foregoing, EFS may use and exchange User Data in accordance with standard DMA practices for purposes of customer prospecting solely in order to grow the Playboy Commerce Business.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS shall use User Data for the operation and promotion of the Playboy Commerce Business, and may also use such User Data to market other EFS products and services to users, unless explicitly prohibited by the user at the time of data collection. Client approval is not required for such use. Notwithstanding the foregoing, EFS may not use and exchange User Data in accordance with standard DMA practices, except where this benefits the Playboy Commerce Business.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts EFS from using User Data to market other products without explicit approval from Client. The modified version allows EFS to use User Data to market its own products unless users explicitly opt-out, directly contradicting the prior restriction and creating ambiguity about the control over user data.

perturbation.original_text: Client shall be entitled to receive an advertising fee of ***** of the Net Advertising Revenue derived by EFS from Advertisements pursuant to Section 4.4 (“Advertising Fee”). “Net Advertising Revenue” shall be defined as the gross revenue derived from the sale of Advertisements less: (a) all direct costs (i.e., commissions and ad-server related fees) incurred by EFS and third party fees paid out by EFS for the execution, maintenance and ongoing facilitation of Advertisements on the Websites and (b) ***** of gross revenue derived from the sale of Advertisements, which shall be reinvested by EFS for online promotions and advertising (“Advertising Marketing Allocation”). Neither Net Advertising Revenue nor the Advertising Fee shall be counted toward the Minimum Royalty obligation of EFS.
perturbation.changed_text: Client shall be entitled to receive an advertising fee, the amount of which will be mutually determined based on market conditions and the performance of advertising campaigns, derived by EFS from Advertisements pursuant to Section 4.4 (“Advertising Fee”). “Net Advertising Revenue” shall be defined as the gross revenue derived from the sale of Advertisements less: (a) mutually agreed costs incurred by EFS and third party fees paid out by EFS for the execution, maintenance and ongoing facilitation of Advertisements on the Websites and (b) a percentage of gross revenue, as decided between both parties on a quarterly basis, which shall be reinvested by EFS for online promotions and advertising (“Advertising Marketing Allocation”). The Advertising Fee shall be counted toward the Minimum Royalty obligation of EFS, unless the parties decide otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a specific percentage for the Advertising Fee. The modified text makes this fee amount subject to mutual determination, contradicting the previous fixed percentage and creating uncertainty. It also changes the allocation of advertising revenue and whether it counts toward the minimum royalty obligation, again introducing contradiction and ambiguity.
